intro: Celmisia brevifolia, commonly known as the short-leaved celmisia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and clusters of small, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine regions, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, providing insulation against harsh weather conditions. Celmisia brevifolia is often found in rocky or scree habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
